page:body.p: Please use this new README to inform users about changes in the code or behaviour of Lenya. It is located under src/webapp/readme.xml. Its contents will be shown on the global welcome page, and also on the introduction page of every publication.
page:body.h2: Important notes for beta testers of Lenya 1.4
page:body.p: In order to make the Lenya publication configuration more self-explanatory, the directory $YOURPUB/config/ac has been renamed to $YOURPUB/config/access-control. You will have to change your custom publications accordingly.
page:body.h3: 2007-04-13: You need to update your custom publication.xconf files!
page:body.p:
As of revision FIXME, the file $YOURPUB/publication.xml is no longer used. Its contents should be moved to $YOURPUB/config/publication.xconf. To accomodate this, the format of publication.xconf has changed a bit (see below).
Sorry for the breakage, but we were able to eliminate a lot of old ad-hoc code and duplication with this change, and the new xconf file looks a lot nicer and more intuitive.

Most important changes: All elements in publication.xconf must now be in the namespace http://apache.org/cocoon/lenya/publication/1.1, and <module/>, <proxy/>, and <resource-type> elements must now be grouped in <modules/>, <proxies/>, and <resource-types/>. See the default publication for an example.
You can use the RNG schema at webapp/lenya/resources/schemas/publication.rng to verify that your file is correct:
cd $LENYA_HOME
java -jar lib/jing-20030619.jar src/webapp/lenya/resources/schemas/publication.rng $YOURPUB/config/publication.xconf

If you want to provide a custom README for your publication (maybe you have used the old <lenya:readme/> in the now gone publication.xml), you can put it in $YOURPUB/readme.xml. It is now a standard Lenya CMS page in the http://apache.org/cocoon/lenya/cms-page/1.0 namespace.
